name: London Fire Department
description: Municipal fire department serving the City of London, Kentucky since 1922. Provides comprehensive fire protection, emergency response, life safety, and support services to the community. Operates 24/7 emergency response with professional firefighters and modern firefighting equipment. Offers fire prevention education, community outreach programs, and emergency medical services. Led by Fire Chief Donnie Hale, the department is dedicated to protecting life and property through rapid emergency response and proactive fire safety education.
source: Verified from official website and multiple sources
hours_of_operation: 24/7 Emergency Response. Administrative hours: Monday-Friday 8:00 AM-4:00 PM
eligibility: Emergency services available to all residents and visitors in London, Kentucky
services: Fire suppression, Emergency response, Fire prevention education, Life safety services, Community outreach, Emergency medical services, Fire safety training
notes: Department has been serving since 1922 and has 9.7K+ followers on Facebook. Rated 5.0/5 on Google with 4 reviews. For emergencies, call 911. The department provides fire safety education and community programs including working with local schools and organizations.
